project.description:
• Step 0: (Optionally) Run WTP Publish job to rename from I to S build.
  • Step 1: Copy WTP_Smoke_Test_Results template to a new page.
  • Step 2: Update WTP_Smoke_Test_Results with link to new smoke test page for the latest build.
  • Step 3: Send email announcing smoke test.
  • Note: check your spam folder if using recipientOverride.

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: buildRenamed

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: recipientOverride
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: use your own email address here for testing, before sending to list

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
if [[ ${recipientOverride} ]]; then TOrecipients="${recipientOverride}" CCrecipients="${recipientOverride}" fi sender="nboldt@redhat.com"
if [[ ${buildRenamed} == "true" ]]; then buildURL=http://build.eclipse.org/webtools/committers/wtp-R${stream}-I/${BUILDDATE}/S-${stream}.${versionSuffix}-${BUILDDATE}/ else buildURL=http://build.eclipse.org/webtools/committers/wtp-R${stream}-I/${BUILDDATE}/I-${stream}-${BUILDDATE}/ fi
subject="Smoke Test Request for WTP ${stream} I-build ${BUILDDATE} towards WTP ${stream} ${versionSuffix}" rm -f ${WORKSPACE}/mailbody.${JOB_NAME}.txt echo " Please document your project's testing and approval of this build, by noon on ${GOLIVEDATE}, or reply to this message if that's not possible.
Unless an explicit -1 or other rejection is sent to this list, it will be assumed this build is green and will be contributed to the simrel site.
PLEASE ENSURE YOU HAVE TESTED WITH *BOTH* JDK 11 and 8, as we support both.
Current Build:
${buildURL}
Smoke Test:
https://wiki.eclipse.org/WTP_Smoke_Test_Results_R${stream}_${BUILDDATE}
Thanks for your assistance in assuring quality in Web Tools!
---
Previous Smoke Tests:
https://wiki.eclipse.org/WTP_Smoke_Test_Results
WTP Schedule:
http://www.google.com/calendar/embed?src=23u09qluqisen61r5r585ke1uc%40group.calendar.google.com
Sim Rel Schedule:
http://www.google.com/calendar/embed?src=gchs7nm4nvpm837469ddj9tjlk%40group.calendar.google.com
" >> ${WORKSPACE}/mailbody.${JOB_NAME}.txt
/usr/bin/mailx -s "${subject}" -c "${CCrecipients}" -r "${sender}" "${TOrecipients}" < ${WORKSPACE}/mailbody.${JOB_NAME}.txt rm -f ${WORKSPACE}/mailbody.${JOB_NAME}.txt
